column3: Well, if it isn't <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. I hope this <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>eve<Else/>morn</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>day<Else/>eve</If></If> in Porta Praetoria finds you well.

An honor and a pleasure as always, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! What brings you all the way to Porta Praetoria on this fine <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>eve<Else/>morn</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>day<Else/>eve</If></If>?
What kind of place is this?

Fight for the Ala Mhigan Resistance, what else? I was but a child when I fled the city with my parents, and I remember little of life before the Garleans came...but I still see her streets in my dreams.

Those memories are what brought me here. Though a part of me never thought we'd make it this far! I mean, by Rhalgr, we're within spitting distance of Cotter's citadel! We're almost there. We're almost home...
Protect and serve Ala Mhigo, what else? I was but a child when I fled the city with my parents, and I remember little of life before the Garleans came...but I still see her streets in my dreams.

Those memories are what brought me here. Though a part of me never thought we'd make it this far! I mean, by Rhalgr, we actually beat the bastards! Zenos and the lot of them! It's like something out of a song...
Porta Praetoria? Our last camp before Ala Mhigo, and the point of entry to Castrum Abania. Though I reckon you know that since you came through there.
This passage between the Peaks and the Lochs has always held strategic importance, but it was the Garleans who went and built a bloody fortress right on top of it.
Though it's our fortress now, heh heh, along with all her supplies! We've more than enough to sustain us through our assault on the city!
Porta Praetoria? The last stop before Ala Mhigo, and the point of entry to Castrum Abania. Though I reckon you know that since you came through there.
This passage between the Peaks and the Lochs has always held strategic importance, but it was the Garleans who went and built a bloody fortress right on top of it.
I suppose we ought to thank 'em, eh? It'll come in handy should we need to repel another invasion. But let's all hope it doesn't come to that any time soon.
